Business StrategyDuncan Lindsay
Business Development and Sales
Newcastle upon Tyne
Summary
A Business Development professional, Duncan Lindsay has thirty
years managerial experience in Engineering and Commercial roles
for manufacturing businesses, within a number of markets including;
plastics injection molding; automotive chassis and steering systems;
components for biomedical implantable devices; microsystems and
nanotechnologies; down-hole sensors and printable electronics.
New Product Development Projects participated in, include:
High Temperature Electronics Ceramic Packaging; MEMS
Microbalance; Semiconductor Assembly

Newcastle upon Tyne
Summary
A Business Development professional, Duncan Lindsay has thirty
years managerial experience in Engineering and Commercial roles
for manufacturing businesses, within a number of markets including;
plastics injection molding; automotive chassis and steering systems;
components for biomedical implantable devices; microsystems and
nanotechnologies; down-hole sensors and printable electronics.
New Product Development Projects participated in, include:
High Temperature Electronics Ceramic Packaging; MEMS
Microbalance; Semiconductor Assembly and Test Equipment;
Additive Manufacturing; Ruggedized Sensor for Harsh Environment
application; printed electronics for IoT devices.
Experience
CPI
Printed Electronics Business Development and Sales
2014 - Present  (6 years)
Sedgefield, County Durham, UK
The National Printable Electronics Centre is working with UK companies and
European collaborators  to develop the next generation of electronics with
novel functionalities, flexibility and form factors. 
Rautaki
Director
April 2010 - September 2016  (6 years 6 months)
Rautaki consultancy business.
Examples of New Business and Product Development Projects carried
out for clients include: High Temperature Electronics Ceramic Packaging;
MEMS Microbalance; Semiconductor Assembly and Test Equipment; Additive
Manufacturing; Ruggedised Sensor for Harsh Environment application.
  Page 1 of 3
   
INEX, Newcastle University
Business Development Manager
October 2004 - February 2010  (5 years 5 months)
INEX is a leading contract development, manufacturing and commercialisation
centre for specialist electronic devices, Microsystems, MEMS, and
nanotechnology. 
Identified and secured new product development projects. Project
management with cross functional team to deliver new product development
in a leading edge MEMS fabrication facility. Account management and Sales
Pipeline management.
Bishop Manufacturing Technology Ltd
Business Development Manager
2001 - 2004  (3 years)
Sydney, Australia
Led the sales team with responsibility for global internal and external sales of,
warm forging equipment, hydraulic valve manufacturing equipment,  injection
moulding tools, multistage press tools, bespoke machinery and precision
machining. Clients in Automotive, Biomedical, F1 and Telecommunications
business sectors.
Bishop Steering Technology Ltd
Engineering Manager, Asia Pacific
1998 - 2001  (3 years)
Sydney, Australia
A leading technology provider in automotive hydraulic power steering, Bishop
held IP applied in 20% of the world’s passenger cars including Warm Forged
Variable Ratio Rack and Pinion gears;  Hydraulic Servo Valve for power
assistance. 
Led a team of engineers and a precision engineering workshop with
responsibility for new product development, design and prototype services for
global customers, working with offices in US, AP and Europe. Responsible for
technical account management and technology transfer in AP.
Tenneco
Engineering and Sales Manager
1996 - 1998  (2 years)
Monroe Springs, Sydney, Australia.
  Page 2 of 3
   
I progressed through the company to this role in 1990. I managed the New
Product Development and Sales teams in Australia and New Zealand; As part
of a global Tenneco strategy the Monroe Springs business became a global
OEM supplier.
Education
Macquarie Graduate School of Management (MGSM)
Macquaire Advanced Management Program, Business  · (1996 - 1996)
  Page 3 of 3

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
